contents.markdown: While not as common as unaffixed or _ma_- adjectives, _naka_- and _nakaka_- adjectives are still fairly frequently used. Be careful not to get these confused with the completed/uncompleted forms of _maka_- verbs. For example:

item.english: was able to concentrate (completed form of makatutok)

contents.markdown: Sometimes the stress is different, but other times you will have to rely on context to tell these apart.
_Naka_- brings the nuance of “in the condition of” or “wearing” the root word.
Ex: sapatos = shoes => nakasapatos = wearing shoes

item.tagalog: Marami ang hindi nakasapatos na mga bata dito.
item.english: There are many kids not wearing shoes here.
The one who is concentrating on work is tired.

contents.markdown: _Nakaka_- brings the nuance of “feeling like” the root word.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Nakatira kami ng kasama ko sa sarili naming lugar nang kalahating taon.
exampleSentences.english: My companion and I lived in our own place for half a year.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Sabi niya, wala dun ang mga nakasapatos.
exampleSentences.english: He said the ones wearing shoes are not there.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Hindi nakakapag-aral si Joe, pero talagang nakatutok siya.
exampleSentences.english: Joe is not able to study, but he is really focused.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Alin ang nakakatakot na bagay sa kuwarto mo sa gabi?
exampleSentences.english: Which is the scary thing in your room at night?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ayaw ni Analyn ang trabaho niya, kasi nakakainis ito.
exampleSentences.english: Analyn hates her job, because it is annoying.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Sa tingin ko, nakakatuwa umakyat sa puno sa ibabaw ng eskwelahan.
exampleSentences.english: I think that it is fun to climb the tree above the school.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Nasaan po ang babaeng nakatira dito nung taong isang libo, siyam na raan at lima?
exampleSentences.english: Where is the woman who lived here in the year 1905?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Nakapunta lang si Luis nung nakasapatos siya, di ba?
exampleSentences.english: Luis was only able to go when he was wearing shoes, wasn't he?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Tagasaan ang estudyanteng nakatutok sa bisikleta?
exampleSentences.english: Where is the student focused on bicycles from?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Nakakatakot ba para sa iyo, kapag wala sa bahay ang asawa mo?
exampleSentences.english: Is it scary, for you, when your husband is not home?
